Smoothed Particle Hydrodynamics Manual

A comprehensive guide to Smoothed Particle Hydrodynamics (SPH), offering a deep dive into SPH principles and applications. Designed for researchers, engineers, and students, it covers foundational concepts, advanced techniques, and practical examples for effective SPH implementation in scientific and engineering projects.

View the Project on GitHub AhmedSalih3d/SmoothedParticleHydrodynamicsManual

Smoothing Kernels

Now we are here!

Recall that q is defined as $q = r/h$.

\[\begin{equation} W(q) = \alpha_D \left( 1 - \frac{q}{2} \right)^4 (2q + 1) \quad \text{for} \quad 0 \leq q \leq 2 \label{eq:wendland_quintic_kernel} \end{equation}\]

Where $\alpha_D$ is equal to $\frac{7}{4\pi h^2}$ in 2D and $\frac{21}{16\pi h^3}$ in 3D. $\eqref{eq:wendland_quintic_kernel}$
